thread.title: Fire Prrevention Parade Monday Night Downtown
thread.title_full: Fire Prrevention Parade Monday Night Downtown

author: Edited from a Press Release
title: Fire Prrevention Parade Monday Night Downtown
text:
Sunday, October 4, 2015 - 18:45 Updated 1 hour ago Edited from a Press Release File Photo/Chris Spencer Get ready for flashing lights, sirens and candy in downtown Huntington! The 62nd annual Fire Prevention Parade is tomorrow evening. Do you plan on going? Here's what you need to know: 
PARKING: "No parking between the hours of 5 p.m. and 10 p.m." will be posted on 4th Avenue between 7th Street and Hal Greer Boulevard. 
ROAD CLOSURES: 4th Avenue between 7th Street and Hal Greer Boulevard will be closed from 5 to no later than 10 p.m. 
PARADE LINEUP: Parade participants will be asked to line up beginning at 6 p.m. between 12th Street and Hal Greer Boulevard. 
PARADE ROUTE: The parade will begin at 7 p.m. at 12th Street and 4th Avenue and proceed west on 4th Avenue to 8th Street. 
THEME: The theme of this year's parade is “Hear the Beep Where You Sleep,” a reminder that smoke alarms should be installed in every bedroom, outside each separate sleeping area and on every level of your home, including the basement. RULES: In the interest of safety, parade participants will be prohibited from throwing candy this year. However, a representative for each parade participant will be allowed to walk along the sides of the street and hand out candy to children. HOW TO BECOME A PARTICIPANT: Contact Huntington Fire Lt. Scott Ramey at 304-638-5727 or sramey@cityofh
